meanings.definition: The area of reduced air pressure and drag behind a moving vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The car moved smoothly through the slipstream behind the truck.
meanings.sent2: Race car drivers use the slipstream to gain speed and overtake opponents.
meanings.sent3: The little bird enjoyed flying in the slipstream of the big airplane.
meanings.sent4: The slipstream of the boat created a gentle breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: In the slipstream, the wind felt cool and refreshing.

meanings.definition: To follow closely behind another vehicle to take advantage of the reduced air resistance.
meanings.sent1: The cyclist decided to slipstream behind the lead rider to conserve energy.
meanings.sent2: During the race, the runner strategically slipstreamed behind the fastest competitor.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat tried to slipstream behind the dog without being noticed.
meanings.sent4: The students learned to slipstream behind the teacher to avoid getting in trouble.
meanings.sent5: To save fuel, the airplane pilot chose to slipstream behind a larger aircraft.

meanings.definition: A current of air or water created by a moving object.
meanings.sent1: The airplane's engines produced a powerful slipstream during takeoff.
meanings.sent2: The boat's propeller churned the water, creating a visible slipstream.
meanings.sent3: The playful otters rode the slipstream created by the passing speedboat.
meanings.sent4: The wind turbines harness the slipstream to generate electricity.
meanings.sent5: The kite soared high in the sky, carried by the slipstream.
